attribute.description: ADC Channel function id. 16 channels.
ADC channel gain * 1000. 16 channels.
ADC Channel ground. 16 channels.
ADC channel offset * 1000. 16 channels
ADC Channel IPMI sensor numbers. 16 channels.
APSS GPIO PORT MODES
APSS GPIO PORT PINS Port0 pin 0-7 Port1 pin 8-15
The type of hardware of the BMC
The manufacturer of the BMC
max size of error log that can be sent to BMC
The software type of the BMC

The PLDM boot progress state of the ongoing IPL. Supported states: COMPLETED = 2 (HBRT state) MEM_INITIALIZATION = 3 SEC_PROC_INITIALIZATION = 5 BASE_BOARD_INITIALIZATION = 22 PRIMARY_PROC_INITIALIZATION = 26
HTMGT calculates the total non-GPU maximum power in W when the CPUs are at max frequency and memory at max power (least throttled) and then adds MISC_SYSTEM_COMPONENTS_MAX_POWER_WATTS

HTMGT calculates the total processor/memory power drop in W when the CPUs are at min frequency and memory at min power (most throttled). This is the how much CALCULATED_MAX_SYS_POWER_EXCLUDING_GPUS can be reduced by.

complexType.description: Structure which describes the "Entity Identification Information" data type defined by the "Platform Level Data Model (PLDM) for Platform Monitoring and Control" specification (a.k.a. DSP0248) published by the DMTF. WARNING: All fields are little endian. Gives the entity identification information for the chassis.

field.description: Combination of the P/L bit and the Entity ID value. The P/L bit is a bit indicating whether the entity is a physical (0b0) or logical (0b1) entity. The Entity ID is a 15-bit value from DSP0249 that identifies the general type of entity.
field.name: entityType

field.description: 16-bit number that differentiates among instances of entities that have the same Entity Type and Container ID values.
field.name: entityInstanceNumber

field.description: A 16-bit number that identifies the containing entity that the Entity Instance Number is defined relative to. If this value is 0x0000, the containing entity is considered to be the overall system.
field.name: containerId

attribute.description: Stores "Entity Identification Information" for a given entity, as defined in the "Platform Level Data Model (PLDM) for Platform Monitoring and Control" specification (a.k.a. DSP0248) published by the DMTF. A value of 0x000000000000 is assumed not to be valid. Hostboot populates this attribute on platforms that support PLDM after determining the final PLDM Entity Identification Information for various FRUs. HDAT consumes this attribute when building the SLCA on said platforms.

complexType.description: Matches PLDM_ENTITY_ID field descriptions. WARNING: All fields are little endian.

field.description: See PLDM_ENTITY_ID for description of field
field.name: entityType

field.description: See PLDM_ENTITY_ID for description of field
field.name: entityInstanceNumber

field.description: See PLDM_ENTITY_ID for description of field
field.name: containerId

attribute.description: Stores "Entity Identification Information" for a connector (socket/dimm_slot) that this target uses, as defined in the "Platform Level Data Model (PLDM) for Platform Monitoring and Control" specification (a.k.a. DSP0248) published by the DMTF. A value of 0x000000000000 is assumed not to be valid. Hostboot populates this attribute on platforms that support PLDM after determining the final PLDM Entity Identification Information for various FRUs. HDAT consumes this attribute when building the SLCA on said platforms.
Weight factor (1 = 0.1) for each core DTS to calculate a core temperature and eventually processor temperatures that is used for DVFS and fan control.
Number of PM Complex resets since the system was booted. Value will only be cleared at power on.
The state of the ongoing HRESET operation, if any.

Flag to indicate whether the target is removed from service by PHYP. PHYP notifies HBRT after removing a target from service and HBRT sets this flag to indicate that. While displaying target state to users through BMC, deallocated targets will be shown as non-functional. A PLDM FRU functional state changed event will be sent when a target is changed to deallocated and that target will be marked as non-functional in its state sensor status.
DIMM Temperature in degrees C that a DIMM overtemp error will be logged calling out the DIMM
Maximum time in seconds allowed without having a new DIMM temperature before memory throttling will occur
DIMM Temperature to invoke memory throttling in degrees C

enumerationType.description: Enumeration indicating the IPMI entity ID, these values are defined in the IPMI specification. These values will be used in place of target type when events are sent to the BMC.

attribute.description: A comma-separated list of location codes to be called out when this target is implicated in an error. The format of each callout is "X:Y", where X is a letter 'H', 'M' or 'L' representing "high", "medium", and "low" respectively, and Y is a relative location code.
See FRU_PATH for description.
Information needed to address GPIO device

complexType.description: Structure to define the addessing for an I2C slave device.

field.name: i2cMasterPath
field.description: Entity path to the chip that contains the I2C master

field.name: port
field.description: Port from the I2C Master device. This is a 6-bit value.

field.name: devAddr
field.description: Device address on the I2C bus. This is a 7-bit value, but then shifted 1 bit left.

field.name: engine
field.description: I2C master engine. This is a 2-bit value.

field.name: vddrPin
field.description: Logical GPIO pin number used to enabled/disable VDDR
Determines which of the N selectable buses the mux will connect to. OxFF indicates no mux present or N/A.
field.name: i2cMuxBusSelector

field.description: Entity path to the I2C mux for this device.
field.name: i2cMuxPath

attribute.description: Attribute to hold 3 possible GPU sensors. Includes sensor types, ids, and OBUS_CFG bits

enumerationType.description: Enumeration defining the offsets into the GPU_SENSORS array.

attribute.description: This attribute holds the values of the I2C address from the i2c device connections as defined in the MRW. It is parsed into a struct in i2c.C
This attribute holds the values of the I2C bus frequency in Hz from the i2c device connections as defined in the MRW. It is parsed into a struct in i2c.C
This attribute holds the string descriptions of the I2C devices from the i2c device connections as defined in the MRW. It is parsed into a struct in i2c.C
This attribute holds the values of the I2C device purpose from the i2c device connections as defined in the MRW. It is parsed into a struct in i2c.C
This attribute holds the values of the I2C device type from the i2c device connections as defined in the MRW. It is parsed into a struct in i2c.C
This attribute holds the number of elements that were found under this particular target, and how many devices are stored in the arrays.
This attribute holds the values of the I2C Engine from the i2c device connections as defined in the MRW. It is parsed into a struct in i2c.C
This attribute holds the values of the I2C Master Port from the i2c device connections as defined in the MRW. It is parsed into a struct in i2c.C
This attribute holds the values of the I2C slave port from the i2c device connections as defined in the MRW. It is parsed into a struct in i2c.C
HTMGT internal flags
Timer value used to periodically clear the PM Complex reset counters. Used internally by HTMGT.
1 = in safemode. 0 = in normal mode.
User power limit information from the BMC to be used if communication with the BMC is lost after system is powered on. Used internally by HTMGT.
When set to 1, signal the hypervisor to inhibit BMC resets/reloads at runtime, for debugging purposes. When set to 0, resets/reloads will be permitted.
See FRU_PATH for a description.
Holds the IPMI instance number for this entity.
max buffer size to use for ipmi messages
Attribute to hold 16 pairs of sensor name, sensor number pairs. A sensor name consists of one byte of general sensor type and one byte of sub-type
Specifies if the mpipl is supported on this platform 0 : No , 1 : Yes
Weight factor (1 = 0.1) for each L3 DTS to calculate a core temperature. A value of 0 means not to include L3 DTS in core temperature.
Last progress code Structure includes nodeId, rolling count and isteps Full structure is defined in progressSrc.H Used in word4 of SRC
Maximum theoretical Vdd current reading in 10mA units. Used when VDD_CURRENT_OVERFLOW_WORKAROUND_ENABLE is set.
External MC and DRAM temperature where an error will be generated in degrees C
Maximum time in seconds allowed without having a new temperature for the sensor covering both external MC and DRAM before memory throttling will occur
External MC and DRAM temperature threshold where throttling will occur in degrees C
External MC temperature where an error will be generated in degrees C
Maximum time in seconds allowed without having a new external MC temperature before memory throttling will occur
External MC temperature threshold where throttling will occur in degrees C
Memory controller temperature where an error will occur in degrees C
Maximum time in seconds allowed without having a new MC temperature before memory throttling will occur
Memory controller temperature threshold where throttling will occur in degrees C
The lowest utilization allowed that the OCC could throttle memory due to a memory over temp condition. (percent from 0-100)
Lowest output power in watts that a user may set, and the OCC can guarantee to hold via processor DVFS under all conditions. Aka Hard minimum power cap.
Power used by components other than CPU, memory, or GPUs in Watts
Machine Readable Workbook safe mode throttle value for numerator cfg_nm_n_per_chip
cfg_nm_n_per_mba throttle N value that was calculated from MSS_DATABUS_UTIL_PER_MBA

A constant power (in watts) that the OCC is to add onto Vdd and Vdn power to represent any processor part that is not measured(i.e.Vcs,Vio) This is used by the OCC to calculate a total processor socket power.
The number of records currently populated in PLDM_STATE_QUERY_RECORDS.
System maximum power cap in output watts when Quick Power Drop line is asserted. This value must guarantee WOF base.

The amount of N Bulk Power to allocate to memory, this value will be used to calculate memory throttles to cap memory to this power. This value must be the left over power from N Bulk Power after allocating power for fixed resources and processor power to guarantee WOF base. NOTE: This value is first reduced by Regulator Efficiency Factor before running the procedure to account for regulator loss.
System maximum power cap in output watts when Quick Power Drop line is not asserted. (redundant power supplies) This value must guarantee WOF base.

The amount of N+1 Bulk Power to allocate to memory, this value will be used to calculate memory throttles to cap memory to this power. This value must be the left over power from N+1 Bulk Power after allocating power for fixed resources and processor power to guarantee WOF base. NOTE: This value is first reduced by Regulator Efficiency Factor before running the procedure to account for regulator loss before running the HW procedure.
Maximum memory power in centiWatts when not in oversubscription. Values populated during istep 18.
Static per port numerator setting when not in oversubscription. Calculated based on memory power with redundant power. Values populated during istep 18.
Static per slot numerator setting when not in oversubscription. Calculated based on memory power with redundant power. Values populated during istep 18.
OCC operational data
Specifies the compatible model name for Opal to key off of. This is sourced from the MRW and should be of the format 'vendor,model', e.g. 'tyan,palmetto'.
Enable Trace lite on openpower.
Maximum memory power in centiWatts with throttle set to minimum. Values populated during istep 18.
Lowest per slot numerator ever allowed when OCC is throttling due to OT. Values populated during istep 18.
0 = set BIOS attribute lookup error to PREDICTIVE 1 = set BIOS attribute lookup error to INFORMATIONAL Default to 1 to allow new attributes to be added without a BMC attribute code dependency.
Count of PDRs sent to Hostboot from BMC. The BMC sends Hostboot its own PDRs as well as the PDRs that Hostboot sent to the BMC in the first place.

Socket and dimm_slot connector pdrs are needed to report uninstalled slots which are used to help identify where to plug in new parts. This support connectors encompass DIMM slots and processor sockets. This support is disabled by default until fully supported by all components.

complexType.description: Structure which describes the "Entity Identification Information" data type defined by the "Platform Level Data Model (PLDM) for Platform Monitoring and Control" specification (a.k.a. DSP0248) published by the DMTF. WARNING: All fields are little endian.

field.description: Combination of the P/L bit and the Entity ID value. The P/L bit is a bit indicating whether the entity is a physical (0b0) or logical (0b1) entity. The Entity ID is a 15-bit value from DSP0249 that identifies the general type of entity.
field.name: entityType

field.description: 16-bit number that differentiates among instances of entities that have the same Entity Type and Container ID values.
field.name: entityInstanceNumber

field.description: A 16-bit number that identifies the containing entity that the Entity Instance Number is defined relative to. If this value is 0x0000, the containing entity is considered to be the overall system.
field.name: containerId

attribute.description: Stores "Entity Identification Information" for a given entity, as defined in the "Platform Level Data Model (PLDM) for Platform Monitoring and Control" specification (a.k.a. DSP0248) published by the DMTF. A value of 0x000000000000 is assumed not to be valid. Hostboot populates this attribute on platforms that support PLDM after determining the final PLDM Entity Identification Information for various FRUs. HDAT consumes this attribute when building the SLCA on said platforms.
Count of Hostboot PDRs sent to BMC
Information about the currently registered PLDM sensors and effecters. This attribute is an array of structures of type pldm_state_query_record_t.
PMIC temperature where an error will be generated in degrees C
Time to wait before PHYP makes HBRT callback to handle the call to do the PMIC health check, time in milliseconds, default to 24 hours, MS_PER_SEC * 60 * 60 * 24, 0xFFFFFFFF = disabled
Maximum time in seconds allowed without having a new PMIC temperature before memory throttling will occur
PMIC temperature threshold where throttling will occur in degrees C

Per Chip. Degrees C to change (+/-) the processor chip VPD DVFS temperature to invoke DVFS (clip max Pstate). Default is 0 (no change to VPD limit) NOTE: If we fail to read DVFS limit from VPD system will go to safe mode.
Per Chip. Degrees C to change (+/-) the processor chip VPD DVFS temperature that a processor chip over temperature error will be logged calling out the processor.
Per Chip. Degrees C to change (+/-) the processor IO chip VPD DVFS temperature to invoke DVFS (clip max Pstate). Default is 0 (no change to VPD limit)
Per Chip. Degrees C to change (+/-) the processor IO chip VPD DVFS temperature that an over temperature error will be logged calling out the processor.
Maximum time in seconds allowed without having a new processor IO temperature before DVFS (if supported) will occur

Frequency (in MHz) for 1 Watt of processor power change. Used by the power capping algorithm to determine how much to change the frequency based on power available. This is used in populating CALCULATED_MAX_SYS_POWER_EXCLUDING_GPUS
Maximum time in seconds allowed without having a new processor temperature before DVFS will occur
The maximum power a single procesor socket can support (in watts) This is used to populate CALCULATED_MAX_SYS_POWER_EXCLUDING_GPUS
Weight factor (1 = 0.1) for each quad (racetrack) DTS to calculate a core temperature. A value of 0 means not to include racetrack DTS in core temperature.

Percentage to lower N+1 Maximum Memory Power and N Maximum Memory Power to account for regulator loss prior to calling procedure to calculate memory throttles. NOTE: The procedure calculating memory throttles do not account for regulator loss.

Indicates if OCC should wait to report DVFS due to power/thermal until max frequency has been lowered below nominal. Default OCC will report DVFS when max frequency is lowered below turbo. DVFS is reported in poll response extended status bits and in OPAL shared memory throttle status byte. 1 = OCC report throttling only when max freq. lowered below nominal 0 = OCC report throttling when max freq. lowered below turbo

enumerationType.description: Enumeration defining the states of an SBE HRESET operation. These values correspond to the values of the PLDM_OEM_IBM_SBE_HRESET_STATE PLDM state set.
Enumeration indicating the IPMI sensor type, these values are defined in the IPMI specification. These values will be used when sending sensor reading events to the BMC.

attribute.description: Minimum soft power cap, this is the lowest output power in watts that a user may set. A power cap set below the hard minimum (MIN_POWER_CAP_WATTS) is called a soft power cap and is not guaranteed under all conditions.
See FRU_PATH for description.
See FRU_PATH for description.
See FRU_PATH for description.
See FRU_PATH for description.
See FRU_PATH for description.

complexType.description: Structure which describes the "Entity Identification Information" data type defined by the "Platform Level Data Model (PLDM) for Platform Monitoring and Control" specification (a.k.a. DSP0248) published by the DMTF. WARNING: All fields are little endian. Gives the entity identification information for the system.

field.description: Combination of the P/L bit and the Entity ID value. The P/L bit is a bit indicating whether the entity is a physical (0b0) or logical (0b1) entity. The Entity ID is a 15-bit value from DSP0249 that identifies the general type of entity.
field.name: entityType

field.description: 16-bit number that differentiates among instances of entities that have the same Entity Type and Container ID values.
field.name: entityInstanceNumber

field.description: A 16-bit number that identifies the containing entity that the Entity Instance Number is defined relative to. If this value is 0x0000, the containing entity is considered to be the overall system.
field.name: containerId

attribute.description: Stores "Entity Identification Information" for a given entity, as defined in the "Platform Level Data Model (PLDM) for Platform Monitoring and Control" specification (a.k.a. DSP0248) published by the DMTF. A value of 0x000000000000 is assumed not to be valid. Hostboot populates this attribute on platforms that support PLDM after determining the final PLDM Entity Identification Information for various FRUs. HDAT consumes this attribute when building the SLCA on said platforms.
This attribute is defined with a mapping to ATTR_SYS_CLK_NE_TERMINATION_SITE to prevent Hostboot from seeing ATTR_SYS_CLK_NE_TERMINATION_SITE when we loop through all attributes during DEVTREE sync.

The state of the system clocks. This attribute is set by Hostboot and read by the BMC on reconfig loops so that it can tell which clocks are functional. See the enumeration SYS_CLOCK_DECONFIG_STATE for the possible values of this attribute.

enumerationType.description: The functional state of the system oscillators.

attribute.description: The state of the system clocks. This attribute is set by Hostboot and read by Hostboot. This attribute is set once at the beginning of the IPL to the value of ATTR_SYS_CLOCK_DECONFIG_STATE and not modified again. See the SYS_CLOCK_DECONFIG_STATE for more information. This attribute exists so that multiple "unknown" clock callouts are idempotent.
Used to enable Vdd current overflow worakaround. To enable this attribute should be set to 1 and MAX_VDD_CURRENT_READING must be populated. Set to 0 to disable.
VRM Vdd Temperature in degrees C to invoke DVFS (clip max Pstate)
VRM Vdd Temperature in degrees C that an overtemp error will be logged
Maximum time in seconds allowed without having a new VRM Vdd temperature before DVFS will occur
